press_menu_buttons_v2.description: Presses a sequence of buttons to navigate menus, bypassing the directional/action mixing restriction. Use for menu navigation ONLY. Returns the sequence of buttons as a JSON array.
press_menu_buttons_v2.python_script:
import json
# input_data is automatically provided as a dictionary
print(json.dumps(input_data.get("buttons", [])))

history.commit_message: Fixing input handling to use the global input_data dictionary directly.

find_path_v3_fixed.description: Calculates the shortest path between two coordinates on the current map. Returns button strings if autopress_buttons is true, otherwise returns coordinate objects. Handles one-way ledges. Avoids walls, objects, and unseen tiles for reliability.

history.commit_message: Updated find_path_v3_fixed to handle one-way ledges (LEDGE_HOP_DOWN) correctly. Approaching from below or the sides is prohibited.
Updated find_path_v3_fixed to treat unseen tiles as impassable for reliable pathfinding. Only known passable tiles will be used.

find_path_to_nearest_unseen_v2.description: Calculates the shortest path to the nearest reachable unseen tile on the current map. Returns the target coordinates and the path plan. Handles one-way ledge jumps (LEDGE_HOP_DOWN).

history.commit_message: Fixed output to return a button sequence when autopress_buttons is enabled.

swap_party_slots_v3.description: Swaps two party members, resetting the menu cursor first for reliability. slot1 and slot2 are 1-indexed (1-6).
swap_party_slots_v3.python_script:
import json
s1 = int(input_data['slot1'])
s2 = int(input_data['slot2'])
if s1 > s2: s1, s2 = s2, s1
# Sequence: Start, Up*8 (to POKEDEX), Down (to POKEMON), A (Party), A (Slot 1), Down (Switch), A, Down*(s2-s1), A, B, B
btns = ["Start", "sleep 500"] + ["Up"]*8 + ["Down", "A", "sleep 500", "A", "sleep 500", "Down", "A", "sleep 500"] + ["Down"]*(s2-s1) + ["A", "sleep 500", "B", "sleep 500", "B"]
print(json.dumps(btns))
